books.title: Test 1
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: The Great Gatsby is a classic American novel that captures the glamour and decadence of the 1920s. It explores themes of love, greed, social class, and the elusive American Dream through the life of Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

books.title: Test 2
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A profound novel that deals with serious issues of racial inequality and injustice in the American South, told through the innocent eyes of young Scout Finch. The narrative is woven around her father, Atticus Finch, a lawyer who defends a black man falsely accused of a crime.

books.title: Test 3
books.author: George Orwell
books.description: Set in a dystopian future where totalitarian regimes control every aspect of life, 1984 delves into themes of surveillance, censorship, and rebellion. Orwell's chilling vision of the future warns against the dangers of unchecked political power.

books.title: Test 4
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A witty and romantic exploration of the complex relationships and social hierarchies of Regency England, focusing on Elizabeth Bennet and her evolving relationship with the enigmatic Mr. Darcy.

books.title: Test 5
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A rebellious and introspective teenager, Holden Caulfield, narrates his journey through New York City as he grapples with issues of identity, alienation, and loss.

books.title: Test 6
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: An epic tale of obsession and revenge, this novel follows Captain Ahab's relentless quest to hunt the elusive white whale, Moby-Dick, and explores profound themes of humanity and nature.

books.title: Test 7
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A charming fantasy adventure about Bilbo Baggins, a reluctant hobbit who embarks on a daring journey to reclaim treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.

books.title: Test 8
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.description: A mystical story that follows Santiago, a shepherd, on his quest to find a hidden treasure. Along the way, he learns profound lessons about following dreams and listening to one's heart.

books.title: Test 9
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: A monumental novel chronicling the lives of aristocratic families against the backdrop of the Napoleonic Wars. It explores themes of love, fate, and the nature of history.

books.title: Test 10
books.author: Cormac McCarthy
books.description: A harrowing and haunting post-apocalyptic narrative following a father and son as they navigate a desolate landscape, clinging to hope and each other for survival.
